tests.test_body:
105: public void testGroovy() throws Exception {
106: Options options = new Options();
107: 108: options.addOption(
109: OptionBuilder.withLongOpt("define").
110: withDescription("define a system property").
111: hasArg(true).
112: withArgName("name=value").
113: create('D'));
114: options.addOption(
115: OptionBuilder.hasArg(false)
116: .withDescription("usage information")
117: .withLongOpt("help")
118: .create('h'));
119: options.addOption(
120: OptionBuilder.hasArg(false)
121: .withDescription("debug mode will print out full stack traces")
122: .withLongOpt("debug")
123: .create('d'));
124: options.addOption(
125: OptionBuilder.hasArg(false)
126: .withDescription("display the Groovy and JVM versions")
127: .withLongOpt("version")
128: .create('v'));
129: options.addOption(
130: OptionBuilder.withArgName("charset")
131: .hasArg()
132: .withDescription("specify the encoding of the files")
133: .withLongOpt("encoding")
134: .create('c'));
135: options.addOption(
136: OptionBuilder.withArgName("script")
137: .hasArg()
138: .withDescription("specify a command line script")
139: .create('e'));
140: options.addOption(
141: OptionBuilder.withArgName("extension")
142: .hasOptionalArg()
143: .withDescription("modify files in place; create backup if extension is given (e.g. \'.bak\')")
144: .create('i'));
145: options.addOption(
146: OptionBuilder.hasArg(false)
147: .withDescription("process files line by line using implicit 'line' variable")
148: .create('n'));
149: options.addOption(
150: OptionBuilder.hasArg(false)
151: .withDescription("process files line by line and print result (see also -n)")
152: .create('p'));
153: options.addOption(
154: OptionBuilder.withArgName("port")
155: .hasOptionalArg()
156: .withDescription("listen on a port and process inbound lines")
157: .create('l'));
158: options.addOption(
159: OptionBuilder.withArgName("splitPattern")
160: .hasOptionalArg()
161: .withDescription("split lines using splitPattern (default '\\s') using implicit 'split' variable")
162: .withLongOpt("autosplit")
163: .create('a'));
164: 165: Parser parser = new PosixParser();
166: CommandLine line = parser.parse(options, new String[] { "-e", "println 'hello'" }, true);
167: 168: assertTrue(line.hasOption('e'));
169: assertEquals("println 'hello'", line.getOptionValue('e'));
170: }

264: public void testLongLineChunkingIndentIgnored() throws ParseException, IOException {
265: Options options = new Options();
266: options.addOption("x", "extralongarg", false, "This description is Long." );
267: HelpFormatter formatter = new HelpFormatter();
268: StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
269: formatter.printHelp(new PrintWriter(sw), 22, this.getClass().getName(), "Header", options, 0, 5, "Footer");
270: String expected = "usage:\n" +
271: "       org.apache.comm\n" +
272: "       ons.cli.bug.Bug\n" +
273: "       CLI162Test\n" +
274: "Header\n" +
275: "-x,--extralongarg\n" +
276: "                     T\n" +
277: "                     h\n" +
278: "                     i\n" +
279: "                     s\n" +
280: "                     d\n" +
281: "                     e\n" +
282: "                     s\n" +
283: "                     c\n" +
284: "                     r\n" +
285: "                     i\n" +
286: "                     p\n" +
287: "                     t\n" +
288: "                     i\n" +
289: "                     o\n" +
290: "                     n\n" +
291: "                     i\n" +
292: "                     s\n" +
293: "                     L\n" +
294: "                     o\n" +
295: "                     n\n" +
296: "                     g\n" +
297: "                     .\n" +
298: "Footer\n";
299: assertEquals( "Long arguments did not split as expected", expected, sw.toString() );
300: }
